description:
Not sure I actually have the right component here so feel free to reassign if
you have a better idea.

The bugzilla # in the test URL isn't significant, just selected at random.  The
problem is occuring on Mac OS X with Mozilla 1.0.  I don't have access to any
other platforms to test on at the moment so logging as a Mac specific bug.

When viewing a bugzilla bug, if I select File->Save Page As... and then cancel
in the file save dialog I can't try and save the file again.  After the cancel I
get the error message "The link could not be saved.  The web page might have
been removed or had its name changed." when I select File->Save Page As...  Nor
can I reload the page or paste the link into the location field of a new browser
window.  With the test URL listed it results in the error "The file
/show_bug.cgi?id=150000 cannot be found. Please check the location and try
again."  The page is accessible if you quit and re-launch Mozilla.
summary: Canceling a file save fubars a .cgi page until Mozilla is relaunched
